alert.note: Alert for Dooly; Macon (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:19PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Macon, western Dooly and northeastern Sumter Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 219 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Flint River Wma, or 9 miles southeast of Oglethorpe, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, nickel sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vienna, Oglethorpe, Montezuma, Byromville, Lilly, Dooling, Whitewater State Park, Richwood, Flint River Wma, Pennington, Drayton, Clearview and Methvins. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and west central Georgia.
